metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9233 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
XML External Entity vulnerability in libexpat 2.2.0 and earlier (Expat XMLParser Library) allows attackers to put the parser in an infinite loopusing a malformed external entity definition from an external DTD.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9233` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.2.1-2
libexpat1 - 2.2.1-2
No subscription required

libcoin-runtime - 4.0.0~CMake~6f54f1602475+ds1-2
libcoin80c - 4.0.0~CMake~6f54f1602475+ds1-2
No subscription required

firefox - 67.0.4+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 67.0.4+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 67.0.4+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 60.7.2+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 60.7.2+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 60.7.2+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 60.7.2+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 60.7.2+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 60.7.2+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: expat package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.1-2').
swish-e package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
coin3 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.0~CMake~6f54f1602475+ds1-2').
matanza package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
firefox package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '67.0.4+build1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '60.7.2+build2-0ubuntu1').
